document.title: Hot Topic: Three "Hot Topics" Affecting Tennessee Cities: New Vehicle Seizure Law For DUI Offenders and Driving on Revoked Driver's License; Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996; Municipal Clerk Certification Grandfather Period Repealed
document.abstract: Discusses three hot topics: a new vehicle seizure law for DUI offenders and for people driving on a revoked driver's license, effective January 1, 1997; the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996, signed into law by President Clinton in August 1996; and the repeal of the municipal clerk certification grandfather period.
